snippet: Lakhdar Brahimi, the special envoy representing the United Nations and the Arab League, said President Bashar al-Assad was “more aware than me of the scope and the seriousness of the crisis.”
abstract: Lakhdar Brahimi, new United Nations peace envoy to Syria, says, after meeting with Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, that he has not yet formulated a plan to address that country's escalating violence.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Lakhdar Brahimi, the special envoy representing the United Nations and the Arab League, said President Bashar al-Assad was “more aware than me of the scope and the seriousness of the crisis.”

headline.seo: U.N. Envoy Brahimi Meets President Assad in Syria
headline.main: New International Envoy, Meeting With Syrian President, Says Crisis Is Worsening
headline.print_headline: New International Envoy, Meeting With Syrian President, Says Crisis Is Worsening

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
